contentrichtext.text: {{Infobox Former Municipality Japan |Name= Nagawa |JapaneseName=名川町 |MapImage= Map.Nagawa-Town.Aomori.PNG |Since=January 1, 2006 |Currently=[[Nanbu, Aomori|Nanbu]] |Region=[[Tōhoku region]] |Prefecture=[[Aomori Prefecture|Aomori]] |District= [[Sannohe District, Aomori|Sannohe District]] |Area=83.45 |PopDate=February 1, 2006 |Population=8,565 |Density=161.94 |Tree= [[Maple]] |Flower= [[Hydrangea]] |Bird= |Coord= |CityHallLink= }} {{nihongo|'''Nagawa'''|名川町|Nagawa-mura}} was a [[towns of Japan|town]] located in [[Sannohe District, Aomori|Sannohe District]] in central [[Aomori Prefecture]], [[Japan]]. On January 1, 2006 Nagawa was [[Merger and dissolution of municipalities of Japan|merged]] into the neighboring town of [[Nanbu, Aomori|Nanbu]], and thus it no longer exists as an independent municipality. {{nihongo|Nakui Village|名久井村|}} was founded on April 1, 1889 from the merger of seven small hamlets, and neighboring {{nihongo|Kitakawa Village|北川村|}} was likewise formed from the merger of three small hamlets. On July 29, 1955, Nakui and Kitakawa merged to form the town of Nagawa. On January 1, 2006 it merged with the neighboring village of Fukuchi and town of Nambu form the new town of Nambu. An inland village, Nagawa had an agriculture-based economy, with raising of [[cherry|cherries]] predominating. At the time of its merger, Nagawahad an esimated [[population]] of 8,656 and a [[population density]] of 161.94 persons per km². The total area was 53.45 km². Nagawa was served by [[National Route 4 (Japan)]] and [[Japan National Route 104]] highways, and by [[Kenyoshi Station]] on the [[Aoimori Railway Line]]. {{aomori-geo-stub}} {{coord|40|25|17|N|141|19|57.7|E|region:JP_type:city_source:GNS-enwiki|display=title}} [[Category:Dissolved municipalities of Aomori Prefecture]]
